summary:
From 2002 till 2012 I wrote for the British Oxford-based magazine Contemporary Review. This magazine was founded in 1866 as a platform for intelligent discussion and debate. Contributors were, amongst others, W.E. Gladstone, J.M. Barrie and Aldous Huxley. In 1956 Contemporary Review acquired Fortnightly, founded by Anthony Trollope. Unfortunately, the last printed edition was published in 2013. Since then the magazine has been ‘dormant’.
Specializing in contemporary history and international affairs, I'd rather see myself more as a generalist than a specialist. In Contemporary Review I have published a wide variety of articles, book reviews and interviews. Some examples of my articles are:
“The Netherlands: From Euroscepticism to Europhoria” (2001)
“Europe and the New Constitution” (2004)
“Queen Juliana of the Netherlands, 1909-2004” (2004)
“Multiculturalism in the Netherlands and the Murder of Theo Van Gogh” (2005)
“Voters in the Netherlands Defy the European Constitution”
“George Kennan: The Career of a Cold War Diplomat” (2006)
“Dutch Politics: Exchanging Neo-Liberalism for Social Conservatism” (2007)
“The Dutch Commission’s Report on the Iraq War” (2010)
“The Netherlands and its Minority Government” (2011)
“Europe: Quo Vadis?” (2012)
Aside from articles I have also written many book reviews and conducted interviews. In 2014 I contributed to “Farewell MD-11”: this publication looks at the twenty years of service of this three-engined icon McDonnell Douglas MD-11 with KLM Royal Dutch Airlines. “Farewell MD-11” was published in October 2014 by KLM Flight Operations.

I am always on the lookout for writing opportunities and will continue to do so. It is, however, my aim to combine my work in aviation with a (new) career in education. When I was a student I gained my first experience in education through a course at university and I also taught for two years at a tourism and hospitality school. I want to find a school that is willing to give me the opportunity to teach whilst obtaining my teaching degree.
